revision.text:
[[File:Tomb of Suleyman Shah.jpg|thumb]] '''Operation Shah Euphrates''' was an operation by the [[Turkey|Turkish]] military to relocate the tomb of [[Suleyman Shah]] in [[Syria]] conducted on 21/22 February 2015. The tomb had been surrounded by [[Islamic State in Iraq and the Levant]] (ISIL) forces.<ref>{{cite news|last=Kiford|first=Chris|date=2 March 2015|title=Operation Shah Euphrates -- a short military analysis|url=http://www.todayszaman.com/op-ed_operation-shah-euphrates-a-short-military-analysis_374056.html|newspaper=Today's Zarman|location= |access-date=1 April 2015}}</ref>
On the night of 21–22 February 2015, a [[Turkish military]] convoy including tanks and other armored vehicles numbering about 100 entered Syria to evacuate the tomb's 40 guards and relocate the remains. One soldier died during the operation. The tomb complex was destroyed to prevent its use by [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant|ISIS]].
The tomb is now located in Turkish-controlled territory 200 meters inside Syria, 22 km (14 mi) west of Kobanî and 5 km (3.1 mi) east of the Euphrates, less than 2 km (1.2 mi) southeast of the Turkish village of Esmesi (Esmeler or Esme or Eshme) that is in southernmost Birecik District.
Prime Minister of Turkey at the time, [[Ahmet Davutoğlu|Ahmet Davutoglu]] said that later a new tomb will be constructed in Syrian territory.
